MCQ: What is the main function of an operating system?
Choices: a: Manage computer hardware | b: Provide services for programs | c: Hide hardware complexity | d: All of the above

MCQ: What is the purpose of a Process Control Block (PCB)?
Choices: a: Maintain information about the process | b: Store the program code | c: Manage memory allocation | d: Handle I/O operations

MCQ: What is the advantage of using Kernel Level Threads over User Level Threads?
Choices: a: Thread switching does not require Kernel mode privileges | b: User level thread can run on any operating system | c: Kernel can simultaneously schedule multiple threads from the same process on multiple processors | d: User level threads are faster to create and manage

MCQ: What is the role of a Dispatcher in Process Scheduling?
Choices: a: Selects a process from the queue to execute | b: Transfers a process to the waiting queue | c: Manages memory limits for processes | d: Controls I/O devices allocated to processes

MCQ: What is the purpose of Distributed Shared Memory (DSM) in a distributed operating system?
Choices: a: Hide data movement and simplify data sharing | b: Allow processes to communicate with each other | c: Manage I/O devices | d: Control virtualization of resources
